comments.author: BlackHatCoiner
comments.body: Bitcointalk doesn't even have an image upload service, let alone an audio. If you want to upload audio, but with no downloads needed for the users to hear it, better just upload it on a streaming platform. If I were you, I'd just make it a blank video with audio and upload it to YouTube, because everyone trusts that.

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: If you have a video to upload like a YouTube video, you can just paste the link on your post. If you have an audio to upload like a podcast, you can just paste the link on your post. If you want to upload your own audio, you can just write what you want to upload and post it on this forum instead.

comments.author: DdmrDdmr
comments.body: SMF does not seem to have native support for audio, but I’ve read on their forum a bunch of threads that manage it though mods (see https://custom.simplemachines.org/index.php?action=mods and filter by audio or video for example).Obviously, at this stage, the forum's current software is not going to implement anything of the sort (it avoids extra dependences and potential security attack vectors). Not sure if Epochtalk is even considering it so far seriously, although there is a reference to youtube video processing in the code, though I'm not sure where it leads: https://github.com/epochtalk/epochtalk/search?q=video.
